etymology.description: Depicts 街 intersection viewed from above, simplified from 行(行) (xíng, "go")
etymology.interpretation: The character 彳(chì, "walking") represents the image of a street intersection, which symbolically indicates movement or walking. It is used to denote the concept of going or moving along a path.

examples.chinese: 他彳亍而行(他彳亍而行)。
老人彳步(老人彳步)，穿过小巷(穿過小巷)。
examples.english: The old man walked along, crossing the narrow alley.

examples.chinese: 孩子们看到蝴蝶(孩子們看到蝴蝶)，便兴奋地彳走前去(便興奮地彳走前去)。
examples.pinyin: Háizimen kàn dào húdié, biàn xīngfèn de chì zǒu qiánqù.
examples.english: Upon seeing the butterflies, the children excitedly walked forward.
